committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Compensation and Employee Benefits

official_title: To provide that a Federal employee who is separated, due to a reduction in force, within 18 months before becoming eligible for an early-retirement annuity may elect to continue in Government service, without pay, until the age and service requirements for such an annuity are met.
short_title: Federal Employees Discontinued Service Retirement Eligibility Extension Act

summary.text: Federal Employees Discontinued Service Retirement Eligibility Extension Act - Directs the Office of Personnel Management to prescribe regulations that provide that a Federal employee who is separated due to a reduction in force, within 18 months before becoming eligible for an early-retirement annuity, may elect to continue in Government service, without pay, until the age and service requirements for a discontinued service annuity are met.

titles.title: Federal Employees Discontinued Service Retirement Eligibility Extension Act

To provide that a Federal employee who is separated, due to a reduction in force, within 18 months before becoming eligible for an early-retirement annuity may elect to continue in Government service, without pay, until the age and service requirements for such an annuity are met.
